presentation.title: What is a Good API?
presentation.toc: APIs are the digital glue for how companies operate and collaborate today. This marks a fundamental shift from the original idea of APIs as technical interconnections to one of APIs as the business building blocks of digital transformation. What does this shift mean for our API practices? First and foremost, this means that thinking about an API's business value must be a fundamental part of API inception and design. But it also means that we have to think of APIs as products, meaning that good APIs should be reusable so that they become building blocks with a bigger potential. These API products need to be discoverable because APIs only create value when they are being used. This means that portals, catalogs, and marketplaces should become part of the standard API toolbox so that APIs can be easily created, published, found, tried out, and used. This end-to-end view of APIs is what we mean when we talk about a good API: It's an API that is created with a purpose and within an environment that helps making the most out of this purpose.
